stage1.title: Lunch Buddies
stage1.opening: You are a university student. Your cohort mate and girlfriend, Mary, is studying with you today in school. It’s 2.08pm, and the both of you just returned from lunch.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: That meal was so filling I might get a food coma soon.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: Oh man, looks like today is going to be unproductive.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: So how much was it? I’ll eTransfer you.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: It’s fine. I’ll pay today.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: Wow, why’s that?

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: You deserve a treat for doing well for your quiz.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: Thank you!

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: No worries.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: Do you even have enough money for the rest of the month?

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: Uh- I try to spend less.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: But I’ve seen you going out frequently with Jay, Sean and the other guy.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: His name is Peter.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: Yeah, him. You’re not working part time too right?

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: Nope. I just use my savings for now.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: You might not last long with the way you’re spending, John.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: Well, what about you? How do you spend?

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: I try to limit my spending on wants, like branded items.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: Isn’t your wallet and bag is from Yucha?

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: Yeah, but those are birthday gifts from my family. Doesn’t count.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: What about going out with friends?

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: I do hang out quite often, but I don’t spend much. It’s possible.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: Interesting. Anyway, I will also need to pay for my hostel and tuition fees.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: Your parents are not paying for you?

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: I told him I’ll settle them myself first.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: But you don’t have a lot of money, right?

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: Yeah. I need to reconsider how I spend.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: You can part-time. Teach tuition. Work F&B. Whatever.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: I have other commitments in school too.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: Oh right. Community Service Club and Ultimate Frisbee.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: I’ll see what I can do then. Time to continue work.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: Yeah, my assignment is due in 2 days.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: Same.

stage1.decision: Over time, you wonder about your financial status. “Is there anything I can do?” You ask yourself as you spend another graceless night with your friends. Eventually, you decide to...

options.outcome: You found a tuition gig that pays really well. You finally have some income but you still decided to heed Mary’s suggestion to spend less on wants. You feel better offloading some burden off your parents while still being self-sufficient, although you had to struggle with studies and other commitments.

You decided to reduce your spending on wants. Your friends judge your frugality. You told them that you wanted to save more since you’re not earning money. You don’t feel so bad now that you spend less than before, even though you still miss getting drinks and late night supper.

You carry on living and spending your money with your good friends, sometimes even on yourself. Time passes, and you occasionally fear not having enough money to fund your entire university course. The worst that could happen is asking your parents for money. Wealth: -15

stage1.title: Graduation Trip
stage1.opening: You and Mary have finally graduated with good Honours degrees. As such, you plan to go on a graduation trip with her. One evening, you both take a walk along Orchard Road.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: How about Prince Rae’s Town? I love how artistic the place feels.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: Ah, it looks better in winter. Not now.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: Right. It’s probably crowded during this peak period too.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: What about Mory Islands? (points) Apparently that shop originated from there.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: Oh, I’ve read that in the news too. It’s not as popular yet.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: We can travel around the area too.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: Would 10 days be enough?

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: Maybe 12. We could spend a few days up in the hills.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: Nice. I’ll source for flight tickets too.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: And insurance.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: Travel insurance?

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: Yeah. Insurance is a must-have. You’re still under Doricane Healthcare right?

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: That one’s for medical coverage.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: We need to get travel insurance too.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: Well, if you keep your items safe and sound…

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: It doesn’t work that way, John.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: I find it a waste of money.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: You’re paying for coverage. Think protection.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: I’ll protect you.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: Don’t be gross. There are cheap ones out there.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: Then I’ll get them.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: Usually the more you pay, the greater your coverage.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: Logically.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: So you’ll be settling all these for the trip?

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: Can you think of what else to do there?

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: Snorkelling, surfing, hiking. There’s so much to do.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: Yes, we have 12 days.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: We’ll have lots of fun there.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: More fun than strolling along this sad street.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: Hey! You agreed to this.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: Just kidding!

stage1.decision: u return home and excitedly plan for the trip. Towards the finalisation, you remembered the travel insurance Mary kept insisting you to buy. You decide to...

options.desc: Get the higher-end insurance that covers a multitude of travel issues.
options.outcome: You bought travel insurance that covers you and Mary greatly. Mary was surprised by your change in mentality. Though expensive, you and Mary were enabled to travel fearlessly to Mory Islands and participate in a variety of activities, like scuba diving and gliding. She felt that it was the best trip she had so far.

options.desc: Get the lower-end insurance that provides basic travel coverage.
options.outcome: You bought the basic travel insurance that provides the minimum protection. You didn’t spend too much on it, and so you use most of your money on the actual trip. Mary enjoyed the trip very much, as it was her first time participating in many of the water sport activities.

options.desc: Not get any travel insurance and save the money instead.
options.outcome: You chose not to get any travel insurance. Mary was a little upset at you but as the trip progressed, she gradually forgot about it and immersed herself in the activities on the Islands. Unfortunately, there was a delay in flight on the way back. Without insurance, the both of you reluctantly spend another night there.

stage1.title: What’s your appetite?

dialogue.name: Waiter
dialogue.text: Good evening, Sir. May I take your order? (Takes up his notebook and pen)

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: Hi. Can we get the Signature OmuRice Set and the Ultimate-- Omama Set?

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: (laughs) It’s Omu-Ma.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: Yes! That.

dialogue.name: Waiter
dialogue.text: Okay, and your drinks?

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: I’ll have Ice Lemon Tea, and.. (signals to Mary)

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: Passionfruit tea for me.

dialogue.name: Waiter
dialogue.text: Got it. Anything else?

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: No, thank you.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: Omama.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: I have no words. But I have things to ask you.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: Yes Mr. Omama?

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: I’ve been thinking about how to fund our future.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: You mean like buying a car? Condo? Our wedding?

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: Yeah, all those. I realised we don’t have that much money.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: Mmm. Have you considered investments?

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: Yeah. Peter did mention to me about it before.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: Did he mention the different types?

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: He said I could invest in low-risk unit trusts or high-risk individual stocks.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: They all come with different risk levels and potential returns.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: It all depends on my risk appetite.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: Hmm.. seems like you don’t know much about investments.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: Sadly, yeah.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: But how hungry are you to fulfill those financial goals?

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: (stomach growls) … More than my want to eat OmuRice.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: Sounds alot. But if you need the money urgently, we can always loan from the bank.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: Or use our savings first.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: Yeah, why not.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: So many options, huh. I guess I’ll go consider my various options.

dialogue.name: Mary
dialogue.text: Don’t worry too much. You’ll find your answer.

dialogue.name: John
dialogue.text: Yes, Mrs Omama.

stage1.decision: u went home satisfied. That was probably the best OmuRice you had in ages. As you crept into bed, you pondered about how to meet your financial goals. You decide to…

options.desc: Use your savings and take a loan.
options.outcome: You withdrew most of your savings to fund your wedding and took a heavy loan to fund a condominium. Because of that, the interest compounded was rather great, and you took many years to clear the debt. Nonetheless, you were looking forward to the wedding and the condominium.

You bought some high-risk stocks without much financial knowledge. Nobody knows about it except you. Weeks later, you were notified of the closure of the company you invested in. Because you weren’t keeping an eye on the market, it crashed before you could sell your stocks.

options.desc: Invest in low to medium risk instruments.
options.outcome: You chose to invest in stocks that were relatively low-risk. The potential returns weren’t too much, but such investment was suitable given your own financial knowledge. Online advisors and guides assisted you along the way. You watch your investments grow slowly but steadily.
